page.title: 03Dairy Industry.
page.content: Much of the livlihood and prosperity of the area depends in some way or other on the dairy industry.The block lies on the northern edge of the fertile North Shropshire plain, most of the land being given over to intensive grazing. Important offshoots of dairy farming are the industrial firms providing backup, in the form of milking machines, storage tanks and of course cheese production. In the last few years reductions in the E.E.C. quota for milk production have led to cutbacks throughout the industry and have led to significant job losses in an area which had, until then, not been greatly affected by the recession. The position has now stabilised somewhat and there are signs of an upturn in the industry.
